body.div: Here you have some interesting links if you want to contribute to JRebirth projects.

subsection.name: Bugs Tracker
subsection.p: We are using GitHub issue Tracker to follow features requests and bugs.

subsection.name: Continuous Integration Server
subsection.p: We are using a Jenkins instance to build periodically our releases.

subsection.name: Quality
subsection.p: We are using a Sonar instance to finely follow our code quality.

subsection.name: Maven Repository
subsection.p: We are using an Artifactory instance to manage our releases and snapshots artifacts versions.
We are also using it as a proxy repository for our team.
All our releases are sent to our Bintray repository
and are copied to JCenter bintray repository

subsection.name: SCM Browser
subsection.p: Our source code is hosted by GitHub, and shared throught a custom organization named 'JRebirth'

subsection.name: Maven Sites
subsection.p: You can browse our maven sites released at this address.

subsection.name: Runtime Analyzer
subsection.p: YourKit is kindly supporting open source projects with its full-featured Java Profiler. YourKit, LLC is the creator of innovative and intelligent tools for profiling Java and .NET applications. Take a look at YourKit's leading software products: YourKit Java Profiler and YourKit .NET Profiler

subsection.name: Code refactoring
subsection.p: Structure101 provides us a free license to help us refactoring our source code, we still have a lot of nasty cycles we want to suppress. You should visit this web site to learn more about their solutions: www.structure101.com
